title: Digital twins gaining traction in military satellite programs
summary: “We're finally at this transition point, from being a buzzword and experiencing a lot of cynicism, to something that people see a real need for,” said Robbie Robertson, co-founder and CEO of Sedaro

title: Falcon 9 launches cargo Dragon to space station with new solar arrays
summary: A Falcon 9 launched a cargo Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station on a mission emphasizing station hardware and supplies over science.

title: Viasat forms satcoms titan to take on a market in transformation
summary: Viasat’s $6.2 billion Inmarsat acquisition has created a satellite communications behemoth with revenues that would rival other geostationary operators even after their potential consolidation deals.

title: NASA, SpaceX Launch Solar Arrays, Cargo to Space Station
summary: Following a successful launch of NASA’s SpaceX 28th commercial resupply services mission, two new solar arrays, science investigations, and supplies are on their way to the International Space Station.

title: OLM mods as vehicles shuffle in prepartion for upcoming test flights
summary: Starbase continues to find itself in the midst of preparing for the next test flight of Starship, following the events of Booster 7 and Ship 24’s rise into the South Texas sky.

title: NASA Names New Agency General Counsel
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson announced Monday the selection of Iris Lan as the agency’s new general counsel, effective immediately. She succeeds Sumara Thompson-King, who retired from NASA last December.

title: Connecting the Dots | Diversifying into in-orbit servicing
summary: A growing in-orbit servicing opportunity is tempting satellite builders to branch out of communications, imagery, and other standard fare to get a foothold in this emerging market. So far this […]

title: Congress asks GAO for review of GeoXO weather satellite program
summary: The top Republican members of two oversight committees have asked the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to review a major new weather satellite program.

title: SpaceX launches CRS-28 ISS resupply mission
summary: SpaceX launched the Crew Resupply Mission 28 (CRS-28) mission to the International Space Station (ISS) on June 5 at 11:47 PM EDT (15:47 UTC) from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The window for this launch was instantaneous, which put pay to Sunday’s initial attempt due to high winds in the booster recovery zone. However, Monday’s launch conditions were acceptable.

title: UAE outlines plans for asteroid mission
summary: The United Arab Emirates has released new details about its planned mission to the main asteroid belt, one that is similar to an ongoing NASA mission.
